'Microcephaly' is a neurodevelopmental disorder in which the circumference of
the head is more than three standard deviations smaller than average for the
person's age and sex. Microcephaly may be congenital or it may develop in the
first few years of life. The disorder may stem from a wide variety of conditions
that cause abnormal growth of the brain, or from syndromes associated with
chromosomal abnormalities. Two copies of a loss-of-function mutation in one of
the [[microcephalin]] genes causes primary microcephaly.

In general, life expectancy for individuals with microcephaly is reduced and the
prognosis for normal brain function is poor. The prognosis varies depending on
the presence of associated abnormalities.
